description: This Dart source file defines the ApiClient class responsible for handling HTTP requests, authentication token management, and API interactions in a Flutter mobile application.

classes.name: ApiClient
classes.description: A class providing methods for managing API requests, token storage, and token refresh logic for a Flutter app.

classes.name: HttpException
classes.description: A custom exception class for handling HTTP error responses.

methods.name: setTokens
methods.description: Stores access and refresh tokens securely.

methods.name: _defaultHeaders
methods.description: Constructs default headers, including authorization if access token is provided.

methods.name: _u
methods.description: Constructs a Uri object based on a path and optional query parameters.

methods.name: getJson
methods.description: Performs a GET request and returns the decoded JSON response.

methods.name: postJson
methods.description: Performs a POST request with an optional body.

methods.name: patchJson
methods.description: Performs a PATCH request with an optional body.

methods.name: putJson
methods.description: Performs a PUT request with an optional body.

methods.name: deleteJson
methods.description: Performs a DELETE request; does not send a body.

methods.name: _send
methods.description: Core method to send HTTP requests, handle responses, retries on 401, and decode JSON.

methods.name: _refreshTokens
methods.description: Attempts to refresh access tokens using stored refresh token.
